overview_summary: All profiled neighbors have unknown stances on the development (0 support, 0 oppose, 2 unknown). None appear to wield high influence in the community, as both individuals are private landowners with no evident public leadership roles.

neighbors.name: Stephen L. Frushon
neighbors.claims: Stephen L. Frushon is a private landowner in Baltimore County, Maryland, identified as a property owner in the state’s real property assessment database [Maryland SDAT Real Property Search](https://sdat.dat.maryland.gov/RealProperty/Pages/default.aspx). He has no documented involvement in local government or public comments on development issues – his name does not appear in news coverage of Baltimore County land use debates, indicating he has stayed out of the spotlight [WYPR](https://www.wypr.org/wypr-news/2017-03-30/solar-farms-sparking-controversy-in-baltimore-county).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a trusted local intermediary for initial outreach and listen to his concerns, emphasizing respect for his land and privacy in any development plans.

neighbors.name: Edward Heise
neighbors.claims: Edward Heise is listed as the owner of a Baltimore County property in state assessment records [Maryland SDAT Real Property Search](https://sdat.dat.maryland.gov/RealProperty/Pages/default.aspx). The Heise family name has appeared in Baltimore County for generations – for example, an Albert F. Heise of Randallstown (born 1920) is noted in local records[Burrier-Queen Funeral Home】 and a family Bible documents Heise ancestors in the county back to the 1890s [Heise Family Bible](https://www.usgenwebsites.org/MDBaltimore/bible/heise.html). Despite this long local presence, Edward Heise has not publicly taken a stance on development; he is not mentioned in local news or county meetings related to land use controversies [WYPR](https://www.wypr.org/wypr-news/2017-03-30/solar-farms-sparking-controversy-in-baltimore-county).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in person via a familiar community figure, emphasizing respect for his family’s long-standing land legacy and being attentive to any concerns about preserving his property’s value and character.

neighbors.name: State Of Maryland State Roads Commission
